page.title: 11 Banavie Quarry: 2
page.content:
{Noise} There was a great deal of noise in and around the quarry from all the machinery, so much so that the men working in particularly noisy places had to wear ear-muffs, and visitors to noisy machine houses were supplied with disposable ear-plugs called pop-plugs.
{Dust} There was also a great deal of dust from the crushing machines and the quarry owners had installed expensive machinery to prevent the workmen breathing in the dust which would otherwise block there lungs. The workmen also wore face masks. However the tress around the quarry were extremely healthy and one holiday maker from Devon took home a bag of dust every year for his roses.
